conbody.p:
The parameters for configuring a Kafka cluster are listed in the following table. Kafka cluster parameters
Parameter
Description
Cluster Name*
Unique identifier for the Kafka cluster. This is used as the primary key. It can have a maximum of 50 characters.
Description
The description of the Kafka cluster.
Primary Kafka Broker
Configure the primary Kafka broker.
Bootstrap servers*
Comma-separated list of host and port pairs that are the addresses of the Kafka brokers in a "bootstrap" Kafka cluster that a Kafka client connects to initially to bootstrap itself.
Example: 135.234.23.42:9092,135.234.23.43:9092
The default port is 9092. That is, if port is not provided, then 9092 is used as port.
Topic*
Provide the name of the Kafka topic where NS has to publish the data (messages).
Number of retries
Number of retries allowed for each notification. The retries are performed by the Kafka producer internally.
Retry Backoff Period
The amount of time to wait before attempting to retry a failed request to a given topic partition. This avoids repeatedly sending requests in a tight loop under some failure scenarios.
Request time out (ms)
The time (in milliseconds) for which the client waits for the server to respond to a request.
Client ID
An identifier used for logging errors, monitoring aggregates, etc. This ID acts as a logical grouping across all requests from a particular client.
ADD CUSTOM PROPERTY
Click ADD CUSTOM PROPERTY to define one or more name value pairs. These can be used to add additional Kafka producer specific properties, for example, to define maximum blocking time max.block.ms or to define SSL specific properties ssl.truststore.location.
To configure a secondary broker as well, click the Enable secondary broker check box and provide the parameters for the secondary broker.
